org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.fxg.dom.text

Class ParagraphNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.fxg.dom.AbstractFXGNode
      • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.fxg.dom.text.AbstractTextNode
        • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.fxg.dom.text.AbstractCharacterTextNode
          • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.fxg.dom.text.ParagraphNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFXGNode, IPreserveWhiteSpaceNode, ITextNode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlexParagraphNode

    public class ParagraphNode
extends AbstractCharacterTextNode
    Represents a <p /> child tag of FXG <TextGraphic> content. A <p> tag starts a new paragraph in text content.

      • addChild

        public void addChild(IFXGNode child,
            Collection<ICompilerProblem> problems)
        A <p> allows child <span> and <br /> tags, as well as character data (text content).
        Specified by:
        addChild in interface IFXGNode

      • getNodeName

        public String getNodeName()
        Returns:
        The unqualified name of a paragraph node, without tag markup.

      • setAttribute

        public void setAttribute(String name,
                String value,
                Collection<ICompilerProblem> problems)
        This implementation processes paragraph attributes that are relevant to the <p> tag, as well as delegates to the parent class to process character attributes that are also relevant to the <p> tag.

        Paragraph attributes include:

        • textAlign (String): [left, center, right, justify] The alignment of the text relative to the text box edges. Default is left.
        • textAlignLast (String): [left, center, right, justify]: The alignment of the last line of the paragraph, applies if textAlign is justify. Default is left.
        • textIndent (Number): The indentation of the first line of text in a paragraph. The indent is relative to the left margin. Measured in pixels. Default is 0. Can be negative.
        • marginLeft (Number): The indentation applied to the left edge. Measured in pixels. Default is 0.
        • marginRight (Number): The indentation applied to the right edge. Measured in pixels. Default is 0.
        • marginTop (Number): This is the "space before" the paragraph. Default is 0. Minimum is 0.
        • marginBottom (Number): This is the "spaceAfter" the paragraph. Default is 0. Minimum is 0.
        • direction (String): [ltr, rtl] Controls the dominant writing direction for the paragraphs (left-to-right or right-to-left), Default is ltr.
        • blockProgression (String): [tb, rl] Controls the direction in which lines are stacked.

        Specified by:
        setAttribute in interface IFXGNode
        Overrides:
        setAttribute in class AbstractCharacterTextNode
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute name
        value - the attribute value
        problems - problem collection used to collect problems occurred within this method
        See Also:
        AbstractTextNode.setAttribute(String, String, Collection)
